background: Subseasonal to seasonal (S2S) prediction of droughts and floods is one of the major challenges of weather and climate prediction. Recent studies suggest that the springtime land surface temperature/subsurface temperature (LST/SUBT) over the Tibetan Plateau (TP) can be a new source of S2S predictability. The successful prediction of droughts and floods at subseasonal-to-seasonal (S2S) time scales is one of the major challenges of weather and climate prediction, with failures that can result in major adverse impacts on societies and economies. Sea surface temperature (SST) variations such as those associated with the Madden-Julian Oscillations are known to provide a predictability source. Recent studies suggest that springtime land surface/subsurface temperature (LST/SUBT) provides a new source of predictability at S2S time scales. The Global Energy and Water Exchanges (GEWEX) program has initiated the project “Impact of Initialized Land Surface Temperature and Snowpack on Subseasonal to Seasonal Prediction (LS4P)” to investigate the impact of springtime LST/SUBT anomalies over high mountain areas on summertime precipitation predictions.

The background temperature gradient at midlatitudes also affects the activity of baroclinic eddies (Xue et al., 2023), which can further reinforce the zonal wind changes and further influence the zonal wind downstream as the eddies move downstream and interact with the zonal flow. The response of the zonal wind in the downstream of TP is consistent with these studies, exhibiting a significant deceleration of the zonal wind along the jet core over the North Pacific. Meanwhile, a significant acceleration of the zonal wind is found to the north of the jet core, indicating a slight northward shift of the jet stream. Such changes in the zonal wind have their counterparts in the observations (see Fig. 4b). One salient feature in Fig. 5a is the strong negative geopotential height anomaly over the TP at 200 hPa, accompanied with a cyclonic anomalous circulation. Such a circulation response corresponds to the cold anomaly over the TP, where the atmosphere sinks and induces negative potential height anomalies at upper levels. Furthermore, evident wave-like patterns downstream from the TP to the North Pacific are shown in the geopotential height difference in Fig. 5a. The negative center of geopotential height anomaly over the TP extends eastward to Japan, while a strong positive geopotential height center with anticyclonic circulation flow emerges to the east over the Bering Strait with a center around 170°E, 50°N. The wave-like geopotential height differences further extend from the Rocky Mountain across the North American continent, North Atlantic Ocean, and back to the Eurasian continent. The above simulated response in atmospheric circulations is in general consistent with the observed geopotential height anomalies in May 2003 (Fig. 5b). In addition, responses in the geopotential height to the cold TP surface are also noticed in the Southern Hemisphere, especially in the midlatitudes (Fig. 5a, b). Although the teleconnections caused by the heating due to oceanic temperature anomalies, such as those between ENSO and the Asian monsoons, have been extensively investigated (e.g., Wang et al. 2000; Li et al. 2007; Li et al. 2017), the remote effects of mountain heating on global atmospheric circulations have not been fully studied. The LS4P-I experiment provides a chance to explore the detailed features of the TRC wave train as well as the global response of atmospheric circulations to the TP surface anomaly. It is well known and extensively studied that the TP surface thermal state can significantly influence the weather and climate in East Asia (e.g. Liu et al. 2020). Earlier studies have shown that, in summertime, there exists a circumglobal teleconnection pattern (CTP) in the extra-tropics of the Northern Hemisphere along the westerly jet. The latent heat with the strong convective monsoon precipitation is suggested a major driver for the CTP (e.g. Lau and Peng 1991; Lau and Weng 2002; Lau et al. 2004 ; Ding and Wang 2005; Ding et al. 2011).
research objective: The project “Impact of Initialized Land Surface Temperature and Snowpack on Subseasonal to Seasonal Prediction (LS4P)” was initiated to study the impact of springtime LST/SUBT anomalies over high mountain areas on summertime precipitation predictions. The present work explores the simulated global scale response of the atmospheric circulation to the springtime TP land surface cooling by 16 current state-of-the-art Earth System Models (ESMs) participating in the LS4P Phase I (LS4P-I) experiment. More dynamical understanding of the TRC wave train as well as its cross-equator propagation into the Southern Hemisphere will be explored in the newly launched LS4P phase II experiment.

This study has investigated the mechanisms of the global atmospheric response to the TP spring LST/SUBT anomalies in simulations by LS4P-I ESMs. To further explore the TP’s role and the influence of TRC wave train in S2S predictions, we check the response simulated by each model in May. These results taken together suggest that the TRC wave train plays a key role in the influence of TP’s surface and subsurface temperatures on the hot spot regions, especially for the regions in North America, though the detailed mechanisms through which the TRC wave train affects the precipitation in these different regions still need further investigations.
Our aim is to place the TP LST/SUBT’s influence on the global atmospheric circulations with a focus on the dynamical feature of the TRC wave train and its importance for improving S2S prediction.

Compared with the observation, none of the LS4P-I ESMs well captures the observed T2m cold anomaly in May 2003. The ensemble mean of the 16 LS4P-I ESMs exhibits a warm bias of 1.02 °C over the TP, which is stronger than the standard deviation of the observed inter-annual variation of TP T2m (about 0.7 °C). The spatial distribution of the model bias for the ensemble mean is shown in Fig. 1b, which shows a clear warm bias in May 2003 T2m over the eastern part of the TP. The LS4P-I simulations further show that the TP surface thermal state not only has circumglobal influence in the Northern Hemisphere, but it also affects the extratropical atmospheric circulation in the Southern Hemisphere, though with a large uncertainty due to inter-model variability.
methods: In the first phase of the LS4P project (LS4P-I), the year 2003 is the focal case, in which extreme summer drought/flood occurred in East Asia after a very cold spring in the TP. Two sets of numerical experiments were conducted in LS4P-I to investigate the global influence of the TP spring surface temperature anomaly. A first set of runs, referred to as EXP_CTRL, is designed to evaluate the performance of the 16 ESMs in simulating the TP T2m and precipitation anomalies during May and June 2003. In EXP_CTRL runs, the ESMs start simulations from late April or May 1st, and use the standard S2S prediction setting of atmospheric and land initial conditions. Another set of numerical experiments was carried out by the ESMs to test whether the regional bias in June precipitation mentioned in the previous paragraph is related to the bias in May surface temperature over TP. In this set of experiments, which are collectively referred to as EXP_LST/SUBT run, the models’ bias in May TP T2m is reduced by initializing the TP LST and SUBT conditions.

The observed T2m anomaly in the TP is shown in Fig. 1a, for which we use the data from the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA) Climate Anomaly Monitoring System (CAMS, Fan and van den Dool 2008). We use the fifth generation ECMWF atmospheric reanalysis (ERA5, Hersbach et al. 2020), which is referred to as observations, with a regular horizontal resolution of 1.0° × 1.0° to investigate the atmospheric circulation in year 2003 and for climatology, with the latter defined as the average from year 1981 to 2015. All data are provided at 0.5° × 0.5° spatial resolution. The global precipitation data are from the Climate Research Unit (CRU), in which version 4.02 is used when implementing the analysis (Harris et al. 2014; 2020).
findings: The LS4P-I results show, for the first time, that springtime TP surface anomalies can modulate a persistent quasi-barotropic Tibetan Plateau-Rocky Mountain Circumglobal (TRC) wave train from the TP via the northeast Asia and Bering Strait to the western part of the North America, along with the springtime westerly jet from TP across the whole North Pacific basin. The TRC wave train modulated by the TP thermal anomaly play a critical role on the early summer surface air temperature and precipitation anomalies in the regions along the wave train, especially over the northwest North America and the southern Great Plains. These results suggest that the TP LST/SUBT anomaly via the TRC wave train is the first order source of the S2S variability in the regions mentioned.

These results taking together suggest that the TRC wave train plays a key role in the influence of TP’s surface and subsurface temperatures on the hot spot regions, especially for the regions in North America, though the detailed mechanisms through which the TRC wave train affects the precipitation in these different regions still need further investigations. The ensemble model simulations show that, with the strong westerly jet across the extratropical Asian-Pacific region, the TP surface cooling generates a barotropic, persistent (evolving in time scales longer than a month) TRC wave train from TP through northeast Asia and Bering Strait to the west part of the North America, whose features closely resemble the observed geopotential height anomaly from May to June in 2003.

The key features of the simulated ensemble mean of June precipitation in response to the TP LST/SUBT effect were discussed in Xue et al. (2022). The LS4P-I experiment, however, shows that the TP surface anomaly can result in persistent and global scale anomalies in atmospheric circulations, and has a near-global influence on the summer T2m and precipitation on S2S time scale. Furthermore, the LS4P-I experiment confirms and highlights the important even critical role of the TRC wave train in the global influence of the TP surface anomaly. The analysis of 16 state-of-the-art ESMs shows for the first time that the springtime TP surface anomaly can modulate a persistent quasi-barotropic TRC wave train.
backgroundCn: 亚季节到季节（S2S）预测干旱和洪水是天气和气候预测中的主要挑战之一。最近的研究表明，春季青藏高原（TP）的地表温度/地下温度（LST/SUBT）可以成为S2S预测的新来源。成功预测亚季节到季节（S2S）时间尺度上的干旱和洪水是天气和气候预测中的一大挑战，预测失败可能对社会和经济造成重大不利影响。海表温度（SST）变化，例如与麦登-朱利安振荡相关的变化，已知提供了预测的来源。最近的研究表明，春季地表/地下温度（LST/SUBT）在S2S时间尺度上提供了新的可预测性来源。全球能源与水文交换（GEWEX）计划已启动“初始化地表温度和雪盖对亚季节到季节预测影响（LS4P）”项目，以研究春季LST/SUBT异常对夏季降水预测的影响。

research objectiveCn: 项目“初始化陆地表面温度和雪盖对季节内到季节预测的影响（LS4P）”旨在研究春季陆地表面温度/雪盖异常对高山地区夏季降水预测的影响。目前的工作探讨了参与LS4P第一阶段（LS4P-I）实验的16个当前最先进的地球系统模型（ESMs）对春季天山地区陆地表面降温的全球尺度大气环流响应的模拟。对热带环流波列及其向南半球的跨赤道传播的动态理解将在新启动的LS4P第二阶段实验中进行深入探讨。
本研究调查了LS4P-I ESMs模拟中全球大气对青藏 Plateau（TP）春季地表温度/地下温度异常的响应机制。为了进一步探索TP的作用以及热带环流（TRC）波列在短期到季节预测中的影响，我们检查了每个模型在五月的响应。这些结果表明，TRC波列在TP的地表和地下温度对热点区域的影响中发挥了关键作用，特别是在北美地区，尽管TRC波列如何影响这些不同区域降水的详细机制仍需进一步研究。
我们的目标是将热带低频（TP LST/SUBT）对全球大气环流的影响与热带环流波列（TRC wave train）的动力特征相结合，重点关注其在提高季节到季节（S2S）预测中的重要性。

methodsCn: 在LS4P项目的第一阶段（LS4P-I）中，2003年是重点案例，该年东亚经历了极端的夏季干旱/洪水，春季在青藏 Plateau（TP）则经历了非常寒冷的天气。LS4P-I中进行了两组数值实验，以研究TP春季表面温度异常的全球影响。第一组实验称为EXP_CTRL，旨在评估16个地球系统模型（ESMs）在模拟2003年5月和6月TP气温（T2m）和降水异常方面的表现。在EXP_CTRL实验中，ESMs从4月底或5月1日开始模拟，并使用标准的季节到季节（S2S）预测设置的气候和陆地初始条件。另一组数值实验则由ESMs进行，以测试6月降水的区域偏差是否与TP 5月表面温度的偏差相关。在这一组实验中，统称为EXP_LST/SUBT运行，通过初始化TP的陆地表面温度（LST）和土壤温度（SUBT）条件，减少模型在5月TP T2m上的偏差。
datasetCn: 模拟的200 hPa位势高度差的集合均值在图5a中展示，同时与2003年5月的观测数据（图5b）一起，进一步探讨了大气环流对青藏 Plateau（TP）地表温度/土壤湿度效应的响应。

在图1a中显示了青藏高原（TP）的T2m异常，数据来源于美国国家海洋和大气管理局（NOAA）气候异常监测系统（CAMS，Fan和van den Dool 2008）。我们使用第五代欧洲中期天气预报中心大气重分析（ERA5，Hersbach等，2020），该数据被称为观测数据，具有1.0° × 1.0°的常规水平分辨率，以研究2003年的大气环流以及气候学，后者定义为1981年至2015年的平均值。所有数据均以0.5° × 0.5°的空间分辨率提供。全球降水数据来自气候研究单位（CRU），在实施分析时使用版本4.02（Harris等，2014；2020）。
findingsCn: LS4P-I结果首次表明，春季的表面温度异常可以通过青藏 Plateau（TP）调制一个持久的准气压波动——青藏 Plateau-落基山脉环全球（TRC）波列，从TP经东北亚和白令海峡传递到北美西部，以及春季的西风急流贯穿整个北太平洋盆地。由TP热异常调制的TRC波列在早夏的表面气温和降水异常中发挥了关键作用，尤其是在北美西北部和南大平原地区。这些结果表明，TP的地表温度/土壤湿度异常通过TRC波列是上述地区季节到季节变率的首要来源。

这些结果综合表明，青藏 Plateau（TP）的波动列车在TP的表面和地下温度对热点区域的影响中发挥了关键作用，特别是在北美地区，尽管TRC波动列车影响这些不同区域降水的详细机制仍需进一步研究。集合模型模拟显示，随着强西风急流穿过亚太地区的外热带，TP表面降温产生了一个从TP通过东北亚和白令海峡到北美西部的条带性、持久性（时间尺度超过一个月）TRC波动列车，其特征与2003年5月至6月观察到的地势高度异常非常相似。

background: Subseasonal-to-seasonal (S2S) precipitation prediction in boreal spring and summer months, despite including large number of high-impact events, such as droughts/floods, has remained poor for years. Tibetan Plateau (TP) spring observed surface temperatures show a lag correlation with summer precipitation in several remote regions, but current global land–atmosphere coupled models are unable to represent this behavior due to significant errors in producing observed TP surface temperatures. The land’s role in the climate system at various scales has been the subject of much research since the 1970s. A few land surface attributes, such as albedo, soil moisture, leaf area index, vegetation, and aerosols in snow have been extensively investigated to explore their roles in land–atmosphere interactions. Ocean state is well known to play a major role in modulating Earth’s climate. The linkage of hydrological events to sea surface temperature (SST) anomalies, such as El Niño and La Niña, has been used to predict climate events with useful skill at long lead times ranging from a few months to a few years. However, studies have also consistently shown that the SST only partially explains climate predictability. Recent preliminary studies based on observational data and modeling have indicated that spring land temperature in the Rocky Mountains and the Tibetan Plateau (TP) could affect summer drought/flood in their respective downstream regions with a magnitude comparable to the SST effect and atmospheric internal variability. Although land surface 2-m air temperature (T2m) measurements have the best quality and longest record among various land surface variables with global coverage, their application in land–atmosphere interaction studies, S2S prediction in particular, has largely been overlooked.
research objective: To address these issues, the Global Energy and Water Exchanges (GEWEX) program launched the “Impact of Initialized Land Temperature and Snowpack on Subseasonal-to-Seasonal Prediction” (LS4P) initiative as a community effort to test the impact of land temperature in high-mountain regions on S2S prediction by climate models. This study reveals for the first time that high-mountain land temperature could be a substantial source of S2S precipitation predictability, and its effect is probably as large as ocean surface temperature over global “hotspot” regions identified here. The LS4P objective is to examine whether the observed cold May 2003 TP anomaly causes the observed remote June precipitation anomalies over hotspots worldwide.
challenges: Robust land initialization and model configuration are critical to this effort yet remain scientifically challenging. Most studies of land–atmosphere interactions have been limited by a lack of observational data and tend to focus on local feedbacks. Current state-of-the-art ESMs are unable to fully preserve the memory from initialized LST anomalies due to deficiencies in model parameterizations and in the reanalysis data that provide unbalanced initial atmospheric/land conditions. There are two issues that need further investigation: 1) The ensemble-mean-produced T2m difference is smaller than the observed anomaly. Would this deficiency cause an underestimation of the TP T2m effect? 2) In some areas, the ensemble mean produces a significant June precipitation difference, such as in western Australia and western Europe, but with the opposite sign compared to the observation. Is this due to a model deficiency in its ability to produce the full TP T2m anomaly and/or correct precipitation anomaly, and/or some other processes involved?
methods: In this study, observed T2m records are used to examine possible relationships between the TP T2m and global precipitation and to identify the locations (hotspots) where the initialization of TP May land temperatures may enhance June precipitation prediction skill. Two pairs of experiments with 16 state-of-the-art LS4P ESMs (Table ES1) have been conducted. In the first experiment (referred to as control run), we evaluate whether the ESMs can properly produce the observed TP T2m anomaly in May 2003 and the June precipitation anomaly. To alleviate the ESMs’ May TP T2m bias and to generate the observed cold TP spring anomaly, we introduce an innovative approach to initializing the LST/SUBT over the TP. After adjusting the LST/SUBT initial conditions based on each model’s T2m bias and observed anomaly over the TP, a second experiment (referred to as the sensitivity run) is conducted using the new LST/SUBT initial condition for each model over the TP, with all other initial and boundary conditions and ensemble members identical to the first experiment.
dataset: In this study, the Chinese Meteorological Administration (CMA) T2m data, which consist in 80 stations over the TP and more than 2,400 stations over all of China, are used over China. The Climate Anomaly Monitoring System (CAMS) T2m data are used elsewhere. The Climate Research Unit (CRU) data are used for precipitation over globe.
findings: This study reveals for the first time that high-mountain land temperature could be a substantial source of S2S precipitation predictability, and its effect is probably as large as ocean surface temperature over global “hotspot” regions identified here; the ensemble means in some “hotspots” produce more than 40% of the observed anomalies. Consistent results from observations and multiple ESM experiments show that improving the May TP land temperature simulation through LST/SUBT initialization over the TP allows ESMs to better predict June precipitation over hotspots, and that the LST over high-mountain areas could be a new source of S2S predictability through elevated heating.
backgroundCn: 亚季节到季节（S2S）降水预测在北半球春季和夏季月份中，尽管包括了大量高影响事件，如干旱和洪水，但多年来预测效果仍然较差。青藏 Plateau（TP）春季观测的地表温度与多个遥远地区的夏季降水之间存在滞后相关性，但当前的全球陆气耦合模型由于在生成观测到的TP地表温度方面存在显著误差，无法表现出这种行为。自1970年代以来，土地在不同尺度的气候系统中的作用一直是许多研究的主题。一些土地表面属性，如反照率、土壤湿度、叶面积指数、植被和雪中的气溶胶，已被广泛研究以探讨它们在陆气相互作用中的作用。海洋状态被广泛认为在调节地球气候中发挥着重要作用。水文事件与海表温度（SST）异常之间的联系，如厄尔尼诺和拉尼娜，已被用于预测气候事件，并在几个月到几年范围内提供了有用的技能。然而，研究也一致表明，SST仅部分解释气候可预测性。基于观测数据和建模的近期初步研究表明，落基山脉和青藏高原（TP）的春季地面温度可能会影响各自下游地区的夏季干旱/洪水，其影响程度与SST效应和大气内部变率相当。尽管地表2米气温（T2m）测量在各种陆地表面变量中具有最佳质量和最长记录，并且具有全球覆盖，但在陆气相互作用研究中，特别是在S2S预测中的应用仍然被忽视。
research objectiveCn: 为了解决这些问题，全球能源与水交换（GEWEX）计划启动了“初始化陆地温度和雪盖对亚季节到季节预测影响”（LS4P）倡议，作为一项社区努力，测试高山地区陆地温度对气候模型S2S预测的影响。这项研究首次揭示，高山陆地温度可能是S2S降水可预测性的一个重要来源，其影响可能与全球“热点”地区的海洋表面温度相当。LS4P的目标是研究观察到的2003年5月青藏高原异常低温是否导致全球热点地区观察到的6月降水异常。
challengesCn: 稳健的土地初始化和模型配置对这一努力至关重要，但仍然具有科学挑战性。大多数关于陆地-大气相互作用的研究由于缺乏观测数据而受到限制，通常集中于局部反馈。目前最先进的地球系统模型（ESMs）无法完全保留初始化的地表温度（LST）异常的记忆，这主要是由于模型参数化和提供不平衡初始大气/陆地条件的再分析数据存在缺陷。有两个问题需要进一步研究：1）集合均值产生的2米气温（T2m）差异小于观测异常。这一缺陷是否会导致对热带气候（TP）T2m效应的低估？2）在某些地区，集合均值产生了显著的6月降水差异，例如在澳大利亚西部和西欧，但与观测结果的符号相反。这是由于模型在产生完整的TP T2m异常和/或正确的降水异常方面的缺陷，还是由于其他相关过程？
methodsCn: 在这项研究中，观察到的T2m记录用于检查TP T2m与全球降水之间的可能关系，并识别出初始化TP 5月地面温度可能增强6月降水预测技能的位置（热点）。进行了两组实验，使用16个最先进的LS4P ESMs（表ES1）。在第一个实验（称为控制运行）中，我们评估ESMs是否能够正确产生2003年5月的TP T2m异常和6月的降水异常。为了减轻ESMs在5月TP T2m上的偏差，并生成观察到的寒冷TP春季异常，我们引入了一种创新的方法来初始化TP的LST/SUBT。在根据每个模型的T2m偏差和TP的观察异常调整LST/SUBT初始条件后，进行了第二个实验（称为敏感性运行），该实验使用新的TP LST/SUBT初始条件，所有其他初始和边界条件以及集合成员与第一个实验相同。
datasetCn: 在本研究中，使用了中国气象局（CMA）的T2m数据，该数据涵盖了青藏 Plateau（TP）上的80个站点以及中国境内超过2400个站点。气候异常监测系统（CAMS）的T2m数据用于其他地区。气候研究单位（CRU）的数据用于全球降水。
findingsCn: 这项研究首次揭示，高山地区的地面温度可能是季节到季节（S2S）降水可预测性的一个重要来源，其影响可能与全球“热点”区域的海洋表面温度相当；在一些“热点”区域，集合均值产生的观测异常超过40%。来自观测和多种地球系统模型（ESM）实验的一致结果表明，通过对青藏 Plateau（TP）地区的地面温度进行LST/SUBT初始化，可以改善5月TP地区的地面温度模拟，从而使ESM更好地预测6月在热点区域的降水，并且高山地区的地面温度可能成为通过升高加热提供S2S可预测性的一个新来源。

background: The successful prediction of droughts and floods at subseasonal-to-seasonal (S2S) time scales is one of the major challenges of weather and climate prediction, with failures that can result in major adverse impacts on societies and economies. Improving the prediction skill at S2S timescale requires a further understanding of the mechanisms at work for climate variabilities at this timescale as well as the identification of predictability sources. Recent studies suggest that springtime land surface/subsurface temperature (LST/SUBT) provides a new source of predictability at S2S time scales. The Global Energy and Water Exchanges (GEWEX) program has initiated the project “Impact of Initialized Land Surface Temperature and Snowpack on Subseasonal to Seasonal Prediction (LS4P)” to investigate the impact of springtime LST/SUBT anomalies over high mountain areas on summertime precipitation predictions.
research objective: The project “Impact of Initialized Land Surface Temperature and Snowpack on Subseasonal to Seasonal Prediction (LS4P)” was initiated to study the impact of springtime LST/SUBT anomalies over high mountain areas on summertime precipitation predictions. The present work explores the simulated global scale response of the atmospheric circulation to the springtime TP land surface cooling by 16 current state-of-the-art Earth System Models (ESMs) participating in the LS4P Phase I (LS4P-I) experiment.
challenges: The participant models that fail in capturing the TRC wave train greatly under-predict climate anomalies in reference to observations and the successful models. However, the simulated propagation pathways from the TP into the Southern Hemisphere show large inter-model differences.
methods: In the first phase of the LS4P project (LS4P-I), the year 2003 is the focal case, in which extreme summer drought/flood occurred in East Asia after a very cold spring in the TP. Two sets of numerical experiments were conducted in LS4P-I to investigate the global influence of the TP spring surface temperature anomaly. A first set of runs, referred to as EXP_CTRL, is designed to evaluate the performance of the 16 ESMs in simulating the TP T2m and precipitation anomalies during May and June 2003. In EXP_CTRL runs, the ESMs start simulations from late April or May 1st, and use the standard S2S prediction setting of atmospheric and land initial conditions. Another set of numerical experiments was carried out by the ESMs to test whether the regional bias in June precipitation mentioned in the previous paragraph is related to the bias in May surface temperature over TP. In this set of experiments, which are collectively referred to as EXP_LST/SUBT run, the models’ bias in May TP T2m is reduced by initializing the TP LST and SUBT conditions.
dataset: The observed T2m anomaly in the TP is shown in Fig. 1a, for which we use the data from the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA) Climate Anomaly Monitoring System (CAMS, Fan and van den Dool 2008). We use the fifth generation ECMWF atmospheric reanalysis (ERA5, Hersbach et al. 2020), which is referred to as observations, with a regular horizontal resolution of 1.0° × 1.0° to investigate the atmospheric circulation in year 2003 and for climatology, with the latter defined as the average from year 1981 to 2015. The global precipitation data are from the Climate Research Unit (CRU), in which version 4.02 is used when implementing the analysis.
findings: The LS4P-I results show, for the first time, that springtime TP surface anomalies can modulate a persistent quasi-barotropic Tibetan Plateau-Rocky Mountain Circumglobal (TRC) wave train from the TP via the northeast Asia and Bering Strait to the western part of the North America, along with the springtime westerly jet from TP across the whole North Pacific basin. These results suggest that the TP LST/SUBT anomaly via the TRC wave train is the first order source of the S2S variability in the regions mentioned. Furthermore, the TP surface temperature anomaly can influence the Southern Hemispheric circulation by generating cross-equator wave trains.

Definition.QuestionEn: What is the significance of initializing land surface temperature (LST) and subsurface temperature (SUBT) in climate models for subseasonal-to-seasonal (S2S) prediction?
Definition.QuestionCn: 在气候模型中初始化地表温度（LST）和地下温度（SUBT）对于亚季节到季节（S2S）预测的重要性是什么？
Definition.AnswerEn: Initializing land surface temperature (LST) and subsurface temperature (SUBT) in climate models is crucial for improving subseasonal-to-seasonal (S2S) predictions, as it helps reduce model biases and enhances prediction accuracy, particularly in high-mountain regions like the Tibetan Plateau, which are important for understanding precipitation anomalies.
Definition.AnswerCn: 在气候模型中初始化地表温度（LST）和地下温度（SUBT）对于提高亚季节到季节（S2S）预测至关重要，因为这有助于减少模型偏差并增强预测准确性，特别是在像青藏高原这样的高山地区，这对于理解降水异常非常重要。

Definition.QuestionEn: What role do global 'hotspot' regions play in the context of land-atmosphere interaction studies for climate predictability?
Definition.QuestionCn: 全球“热点”区域在气候可预测性的土地-大气相互作用研究中扮演什么角色？
Definition.AnswerEn: Global 'hotspot' regions are critical areas where the initialization of land temperatures, particularly in high mountain areas, can significantly enhance the predictability of precipitation at subseasonal-to-seasonal timescales, indicating that land surface conditions in these regions can be as influential as ocean surface temperatures in climate modeling.
Definition.AnswerCn: 全球“热点”区域是关键地区，在这些地区，特别是在高山地区，地表温度的初始化可以显著提高亚季节到季节时间尺度上降水的可预测性，这表明这些地区的地表条件在气候建模中可以与海洋表面温度一样具有影响力。

Comparison.QuestionEn: In what ways do the challenges of simulating atmospheric responses in Earth System Models differ from those faced in real-world observational data collection for subseasonal-to-seasonal prediction?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 在地球系统模型中模拟大气响应的挑战与在实际观测数据收集过程中面临的挑战在亚季节到季节预测方面有何不同？
Comparison.AnswerEn: Simulating atmospheric responses in Earth System Models involves challenges such as capturing the correct phase and amplitude of wave trains and dealing with inter-model variability, particularly in the Southern Hemisphere. Observational data collection, on the other hand, faces challenges related to the availability and quality of data, such as the limited coverage in remote regions like the Tibetan Plateau and the potential biases in initial conditions.
Comparison.AnswerCn: 在地球系统模型中模拟大气响应面临着诸多挑战，例如捕捉波列的正确相位和幅度，以及处理模型间的变异性，特别是在南半球。另一方面，观测数据收集面临着与数据的可用性和质量相关的挑战，例如在像西藏高原这样的偏远地区覆盖有限，以及初始条件可能存在的偏差。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: What challenges are faced when using Earth System Models (ESMs) to simulate the impact of land surface temperature anomalies on global atmospheric circulation?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 在使用地球系统模型（ESMs）模拟陆地表面温度异常对全球大气环流影响时面临的挑战有哪些？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: Challenges in using ESMs include large inter-model differences in simulating propagation pathways into the Southern Hemisphere and the inability to fully preserve the memory from initialized land surface temperature anomalies. These result in discrepancies between observed and simulated climate anomalies, such as biases in temperature and precipitation predictions, and highlight the need for better model parameterizations and balanced initial conditions.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 使用地球系统模型（ESMs）面临的挑战包括在模拟南半球传播路径方面存在较大的模型间差异，以及无法完全保留初始化的陆地表面温度异常的记忆。这导致观察到的气候异常与模拟结果之间存在差异，例如温度和降水预测的偏差，突显了对更好模型参数化和均衡初始条件的需求。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: In what ways can datasets from different sources, like NOAA's Climate Anomaly Monitoring System and ECMWF's reanalysis, contribute to understanding the impact of land temperature anomalies on atmospheric patterns?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 来自不同来源的数据集，如NOAA的气候异常监测系统和ECMWF的再分析，如何有助于理解陆地温度异常对大气模式的影响？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: Datasets from sources such as NOAA's Climate Anomaly Monitoring System and ECMWF's reanalysis provide observed temperature anomalies and atmospheric circulation data that are essential for validating model simulations. They help identify discrepancies between observed and predicted anomalies, assess model performance, and guide improvements in initializing land temperature conditions for better prediction of atmospheric patterns influenced by land surface anomalies.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 来自NOAA气候异常监测系统和ECMWF再分析等来源的数据集提供了观测到的温度异常和大气环流数据，这些数据对于验证模型模拟至关重要。它们有助于识别观测与预测异常之间的差异，评估模型性能，并指导改进陆地温度条件的初始化，以更好地预测受陆地表面异常影响的大气模式。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What causes the deficiency in model parameterizations and the reanalysis data that lead to unbalanced initial atmospheric and land conditions in Earth System Models?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 导致地球系统模型中模型参数化和再分析数据缺陷的原因是什么，这些缺陷导致大气和陆地初始条件不平衡？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: The deficiency in model parameterizations and reanalysis data arises from the inability of current state-of-the-art Earth System Models to fully preserve the memory from initialized land surface temperature anomalies. This can be attributed to limitations in capturing the full complexity of land-atmosphere interactions and the biases present in the reanalysis data used for initializing the models.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 模型参数化和再分析数据的不足源于当前最先进的地球系统模型无法完全保留初始化的地表温度异常的记忆。这可以归因于捕捉陆地-大气相互作用的复杂性以及用于初始化模型的再分析数据中存在的偏差的局限性。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: Why do the ensemble means of Earth System Models produce smaller temperature anomalies compared to observations?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 为什么地球系统模型的集合均值产生的温度异常比观测值小？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: The ensemble means produce smaller temperature anomalies because the Earth System Models have difficulties in accurately simulating the observed temperature differences. This could be due to deficiencies in capturing the full range of land surface temperature anomalies, particularly in high-mountain regions like the Tibetan Plateau, which affect the models' ability to predict subsequent climate anomalies accurately.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 集合均值产生较小的温度异常，因为地球系统模型在准确模拟观察到的温度差异方面存在困难。这可能是由于在捕捉陆地表面温度异常的全范围方面存在缺陷，特别是在像青藏高原这样的高山地区，这影响了模型准确预测后续气候异常的能力。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What are the underlying causes of large inter-model differences in the simulated propagation pathways from the Tibetan Plateau into the Southern Hemisphere?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 从青藏高原到南半球的模拟传播路径中，模型之间存在较大差异的潜在原因是什么？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Large inter-model differences in simulated propagation pathways are caused by varying model capabilities in representing the complex processes involved in atmospheric circulation and teleconnections. These differences may stem from distinct parameterizations and initial conditions used in each Earth System Model, leading to inconsistencies in the predicted atmospheric responses to the Tibetan Plateau surface anomalies.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 大型模型之间在模拟传播路径方面的差异主要是由于模型在表示大气环流和遥相关过程的复杂性方面的能力不同。这些差异可能源于每个地球系统模型中使用的不同参数化和初始条件，从而导致对青藏 Plateau 表面异常的预测大气响应的不一致性。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: What are the objectives behind exploring the impact of Initialized Land Surface Temperature and Snowpack on Subseasonal to Seasonal Prediction in climate models?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 探索初始化地表温度和雪盖对气候模型中季节到季节预测的影响的目标是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: The objective is to investigate how springtime land surface temperature and subsurface temperature anomalies over high mountain areas, like the Tibetan Plateau, can influence summertime precipitation predictions. This exploration aims to enhance understanding and prediction of subseasonal-to-seasonal climate variabilities, particularly the role of land temperature as a new source of predictability akin to ocean surface temperature.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 目标是研究春季高山地区（如青藏 Plateau）的地表温度和地下温度异常如何影响夏季降水预测。这项探索旨在增强对季节内到季节气候变异性的理解和预测，特别是土地温度作为一种新的可预测性来源的作用，类似于海洋表面温度。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: What is the goal of using observed temperature records to examine the relationship between the Tibetan Plateau land temperatures and global precipitation patterns?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 使用观测到的温度记录来研究青藏高原土地温度与全球降水模式之间关系的目标是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: The goal is to identify global regions, or ‘hotspots,’ where initializing May land temperatures over the Tibetan Plateau could improve June precipitation prediction skills in climate models. This examination aims to demonstrate that high-mountain land temperatures are significant sources of subseasonal-to-seasonal precipitation predictability, thereby aiding in better climate forecasts.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 目标是识别全球区域或“热点”，即在西藏高原上初始化5月陆地温度是否能够提高6月降水预测技能的区域。此次研究旨在证明高山陆地温度是季节内到季节间降水可预测性的重要来源，从而有助于改善气候预测。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What steps are involved in initializing land surface temperature and snowpack data for subseasonal-to-seasonal prediction models in high-mountain regions?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 在高山地区初始化次季节到季节预测模型的地表温度和积雪数据涉及哪些步骤？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: To initialize land surface temperature and snowpack data for subseasonal-to-seasonal prediction models, an innovative approach is used where the LST/SUBT over high-mountain regions like the Tibetan Plateau is adjusted based on each model's T2m bias and observed anomaly. This involves setting initial conditions that reflect accurate spring land temperatures, thus alleviating model biases and allowing for better prediction of ensuing precipitation patterns.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 为了初始化季节到季节的预测模型的地表温度和雪盖数据，采用了一种创新的方法，其中高山地区如青藏高原的地表温度/土壤温度（LST/SUBT）根据每个模型的2米气温（T2m）偏差和观测异常进行调整。这涉及设置反映准确春季地表温度的初始条件，从而减轻模型偏差，并允许更好地预测随后的降水模式。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What methodologies enable the accurate initialization of land surface temperature and snowpack conditions for subseasonal-to-seasonal prediction models in high-mountain regions?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 哪些方法能够准确初始化高山地区的地表温度和雪盖条件，以用于季节内到季节间预测模型？
Enablement.AnswerEn: The accurate initialization of land surface temperature and snowpack conditions is achieved by adjusting the LST/SUBT initial conditions based on each model's T2m bias and observed anomaly over the Tibetan Plateau. This approach allows climate models to better predict downstream effects, such as June precipitation anomalies in remote regions.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 通过根据每个模型的T2m偏差和青藏高原的观测异常调整LST/SUBT初始条件，可以准确初始化地表温度和雪盖状况。这种方法使气候模型能够更好地预测下游影响，例如偏远地区的6月降水异常。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What conditions or approaches are necessary to overcome the challenges of inter-model variability in simulating atmospheric responses to land surface temperature anomalies?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 克服模拟大气对地表温度异常响应的模型间变异性挑战所需的条件或方法是什么？
Enablement.AnswerEn: Overcoming the challenges of inter-model variability requires robust land initialization and model configuration. Utilizing ensemble model simulations and addressing biases in May surface temperatures by initializing LST and SUBT conditions can help mitigate inconsistencies in model responses and improve prediction accuracy.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 克服模型间变异性挑战需要强大的土地初始化和模型配置。利用集合模型模拟并通过初始化地表温度（LST）和土壤温度（SUBT）条件来解决5月表面温度的偏差，可以帮助减轻模型响应中的不一致性，提高预测准确性。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why might the initialization of land surface and subsurface temperature conditions over the Tibetan Plateau be considered a new source of predictability for subseasonal-to-seasonal precipitation in global 'hotspot' regions?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 为什么在青藏高原上初始化陆地表面和地下温度条件被认为是全球“热点”地区亚季节到季节降水的新可预测性来源？
Expectation.AnswerEn: The initialization of land surface and subsurface temperature conditions over the Tibetan Plateau is considered a new source of predictability because it has been shown to improve ensemble model simulations of June precipitation over hotspots. This approach allows models to better capture the observed anomalies, suggesting that elevated heating from land surface temperatures in high-mountain areas can significantly influence global atmospheric circulations and improve prediction skill at subseasonal-to-seasonal timescales.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 对青藏高原的陆地表面和地下温度条件的初始化被认为是一个新的可预测性来源，因为它已被证明可以改善对热点地区6月降水的集合模型模拟。这种方法使模型能够更好地捕捉到观察到的异常，表明高山地区的陆地表面温度升高可以显著影响全球大气环流，并提高亚季节到季节时间尺度的预测能力。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: What are the potential challenges in using observed temperature data from the Chinese Meteorological Administration (CMA) and the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA) for initializing land surface temperatures in climate models?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 使用中国气象局（CMA）和国家海洋和大气管理局（NOAA）的观测温度数据来初始化气候模型中的地表温度可能面临的挑战有哪些？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: Challenges include ensuring the robustness of land initialization and the model configuration given the limited observational data. There's also the issue of model deficiencies in preserving the memory from initialized land surface temperature anomalies, which can lead to inaccuracies in simulating temperature effects and precipitation patterns, suggesting that improvements in observational data integration with models are needed.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 挑战包括确保土地初始化的稳健性和模型配置，考虑到观测数据的有限性。此外，模型在保持初始化的地表温度异常记忆方面存在缺陷，这可能导致在模拟温度效应和降水模式时出现不准确，表明需要在模型中改进观测数据的整合。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: In your opinion, how significant is the role of high-mountain land temperature in enhancing subseasonal-to-seasonal precipitation prediction compared to traditional sea surface temperature influences?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 在您看来，高山地区的土地温度在增强亚季节到季节的降水预测方面，与传统的海表温度影响相比，重要性如何？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: High-mountain land temperature appears to be a significant source of predictability for subseasonal-to-seasonal precipitation, potentially rivaling the influence of ocean surface temperatures over global hotspots. The LS4P initiative has demonstrated that initializing land surface temperatures can improve prediction skill in certain regions, though the approach requires further refinement to fully realize its potential and address model biases.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 高山地区的地表温度似乎是亚季节到季节降水预测的重要来源，可能与海洋表面温度在全球热点地区的影响相媲美。LS4P倡议已经证明，初始化地表温度可以提高某些地区的预测技能，尽管这一方法仍需进一步完善，以充分发挥其潜力并解决模型偏差问题。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please explore different data collection methods that can effectively capture the impact of springtime land surface temperature and subsurface temperature anomalies over high mountain areas on summertime precipitation predictions.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请探讨不同的数据收集方法，这些方法可以有效捕捉春季地表温度和地下温度异常对高山地区夏季降水预测的影响。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: In the field, researchers have utilized datasets like the Climate Anomaly Monitoring System (CAMS) for T2m data and the fifth generation ECMWF atmospheric reanalysis (ERA5) to investigate atmospheric circulation anomalies. Additionally, they have used global precipitation data from the Climate Research Unit (CRU) to analyze the impact of Tibetan Plateau land surface and subsurface temperature anomalies on precipitation.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 在该领域，研究人员利用气候异常监测系统（CAMS）的T2m数据和第五代欧洲中期天气预报中心大气重分析（ERA5）来研究大气环流异常。此外，他们还使用气候研究单位（CRU）的全球降水数据，分析了青藏高原地表和地下温度异常对降水的影响。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please identify potential challenges faced in collecting and using datasets for modeling subseasonal-to-seasonal prediction of weather events such as droughts and floods, especially in mountainous regions.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请识别在收集和使用数据集进行亚季节到季节的天气事件预测（如干旱和洪水）建模时，特别是在山区面临的潜在挑战。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: Challenges include inter-model differences in simulating the propagation pathways from the Tibetan Plateau into the Southern Hemisphere and difficulties in capturing the observed cold TP surface anomalies. There are also issues with the ensemble mean producing significant June precipitation differences with the opposite sign compared to observations, indicating model deficiencies or other process involvements. Robust land initialization and model configuration remain critical yet scientifically challenging.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 挑战包括模型之间在模拟从青藏 Plateau 向南半球传播路径方面的差异，以及捕捉到的青藏 Plateau 表面冷异常的困难。此外，集合平均值在6月降水方面产生了与观测结果相反的显著差异，这表明模型存在缺陷或其他过程的影响。稳健的陆地初始化和模型配置仍然至关重要，但在科学上具有挑战性。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please provide an analysis of how various datasets might improve the initialization of land surface temperature and snowpack conditions to enhance subseasonal-to-seasonal prediction models.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请提供对各种数据集如何改善地表温度和雪盖条件初始化的分析，以增强亚季节到季节预测模型。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: Datasets like the Chinese Meteorological Administration (CMA) T2m data, which includes extensive station data over China, and the CAMS T2m data are used to alleviate the model biases in simulating Tibetan Plateau surface temperature anomalies. By adjusting initial conditions based on observed anomalies and model biases, these datasets help improve the prediction of June precipitation over identified hotspots, thereby enhancing the skill of subseasonal-to-seasonal prediction models.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 像中国气象局（CMA）T2m数据这样的数据集，包括中国范围内的广泛站点数据，以及CAMS T2m数据，用于减轻模拟青藏高原表面温度异常的模型偏差。通过根据观测到的异常和模型偏差调整初始条件，这些数据集有助于改善对识别热点地区6月降水的预测，从而提高亚季节到季节预测模型的技能。
